The ADAR 2-15 Russian civilian carbine that is based on the design of the AR-15. The carbine is produced in St. Petersburg with use of Israeli components and chrome barrels made by Molot Arms.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Scopes compatible with Picatinny rails
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] AAC M4-2000 suppressor

The PKP "Pecheneg" is a Russian light machine gun chambered for the 7.62x54mmR round. It is a modernised PKM machine gun. The Pecheneg is said to be more accurate than all its predecessors due to a heavier, non-removable, forced air cooling barrel with radial cooling ribs and a handle which eliminates the haze effect from hot gases and keeps the barrel cooler, making the weapon more reliable.
 %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: 
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Scopes compatible with Dovetail mounts
 %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] TGP-V suppressor

Modification of an army machine gun with belt feed. Despite the high mass and unsatisfactory accuracy, it has found a fairly wide application in the Zone. It is mainly used to suppress an enemy outnumbered and when clearing mutant lairs.\n
